dashboard.label: NMON Performance Monitor
dashboard.description: NMON Performance Monitor for Unix and Linux Systems - Version 1.6.16

p.b: Nmon Analyser interfaces provides full reporting of almost every monitor available within the application and for the operating system concerned.
p.i:
Nmon Analyser interfaces have been designed for focused time ranges, very large time ranges may require time to be fully processed.
For long time analysis, please consider using metric dedicated interfaces available from App home pages

p.b: Nmon Baseline interfaces provides a system key metrics reporting to help detecting derivation anomalies.
p.i:
The baseline is evaluated over a large dataset of past resources usage and allows determining if the current utilization level represents a potential derivation or normal conditons of use.
With the capacity of charting in the future, you can follow within the day resources usage and easily estimate what is probably not a normal situation for your specific system usage.

h4.i: Data Categories: Explore All / Event Types: nmon:performance (Performance data), nmon:config (Configuration data), nmon:collect (Nmon raw data generation), nmon:processing (Nmon raw data processing) - About Nmon Performance Monitor

single.option: DATE OF FIRST AND LAST PERF EVENT
| `indexes_datestats` | where (sourcetype == "nmon_data") | eval summary="Starts at:" + 'First Event' + " # " + "Ends at:" + 'Last Event'

search.ref: Hosts with data within last 7 days

single.option: | savedsearch "Hosts with data within last 7 days"

search.ref: Number of Errors in Data Processing or Data Collect since last 24 Hours

single.option: (eventtype=nmon:processing OR eventtype=nmon:collect error) OR (index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd ERROR ExecProcessor nmon) NOT ("There is no python in" OR "python: not found") earliest="-24h" latest="now"

h4.i: Enter Splunk Triggered Alerts for Nmon App - Enter Nmon SAFE CENTER dashboard

search.ref: SAFE CENTER - Number of active CPU alerts
SAFE CENTER - Number of active Real Memory alerts
SAFE CENTER - Number of active Virtual Memory alerts
SAFE CENTER - Number of active FS alerts

span.title:
CPU Utilization statistics in Percentage (%)
• Represents the percentage of CPU system load for all available cores
• Statistics can be returned in global usage or main category: Sys,User,Wait,Idle

a.span: ALL OS: Percentage of CPU Utilization

span.title: Click here to access Real Time search simplified interface for this section

CPU Utilization per logical core statistics in Percentage (%)
• Represents the percentage of CPU system load by logical core (lower level of CPU usage details)
• Statistics can be returned in global usage or main category: Sys,User,Wait,Idle

a.span: ALL OS: Percentage of CPU Utilization per logical core

span.title: Click here to access Real Time search simplified interface for this section

Virtual CPU Utilization of Micro Partitions
• A Micro Partition returns its Virtual CPU usage evaluated over the EC or the VP monitor
• Addition of all VP usage of Micro Partitions from the same PSeries will return the global load of the PSeries
Click here to access Real Time search simplified interface for this section

Virtual CPU Utilization of PSeries Pools
• For IBM P5 generation and less, a Micro Partition that has App access will return the load of the PSeries
• For IBM P6 generation and more, a Micro Partition that has App access will return the load of it's Pool, and the load of the PSeries if it is part of the DefaultPool
Click here to access Real Time search simplified interface for this section

Virtual CPU Utilization of PSeries Pools (same as part of LPAR with some additional monitors)
• For IBM P5 generation and less, a Micro Partition that has App access will return the load of the PSeries
• For IBM P6 generation and more, a Micro Partition that has App access will return the load of it's Pool, and the load of the PSeries if it is part of the DefaultPool

CPU Utilization statistics in Percentage (%) for Projects, Zones, Tasks or Users
• Same as 'prstat -J.CPU' (or -Z or -T or -a)
• WLMPROJECTCPU, project name • WLMZONECPU, zone name • WLMTASKCPU, task id • WLMUSERCPU, username

a.span: Solaris: CPU load for Projects, Tasks, Zones, Users

span.title:
Statistics of Main Processes System Resources Usage
• Get the CPU core utilization of main processes aggregated by Command invocations
• Others Statistics available: Real/Virtual memory usage, minor and major faults and more
• With UARG information, filter PIDs from Command to get accurate measures of complex processes

a.span: ALL OS: Main Processes System Resources Usage

p.b: The TOP monitor provides essential resource usage statistics of processes, and has specific interfaces per operating system.

span.title:
Search for PIDs, Commands and Full Arguments of Processes
• With UARG, get detailed information about Commands registered: PID, Full arguments and more
• These information can also be very useful within TOP interfaces for accurate analysis

a.span: ALL OS: Search for PIDs, Commands and Arguments

p.b: The UARG monitor provides PID information with full commands arguments, and has specific interfaces per operating system.

span.title:
Various Kernel File statistics
• Read / Write System calls and other statistics

I/O Adapters Statistics
• Data Rate (Kbytes/sec) and Total I/O Operations (tps) per Adapter Interfaces

Fiber Chanel Interfaces Statistics
• Data Rate (Kbytes/sec) and Total I/O Operations (tps) per Fiber Channel Interfaces

Kernel Internal Statistics
• RunQueue, Swap-In, pswitch, syscall, fork, exec and more

Solaris Processes Activity Statistics
This interface will return the percentage of time processes have spent in, such as
• % of Time in User / System / mode, % of Time processing system traps
• % of Time waiting for CPU, and more

a.span: SOLARIS: Percentage of Time Processes have spent in

span.title:
Paging Statistics
• Pages In / Pages Out (pgsin / pgsout)
• Fs In / Fs Out (sum of pgin/pgsin and pgout/pgsout per interval)
• Scan Free Ratio (Pages scans by reclaims per interval)
And more

Various Virtual Memory statistics
• Pageins / Pageout
• Swapins / Swapout
• Minor and Major faults
And more

a.span: LINUX, SOLARIS: Kernel Virtual Memory Statistics

p.b: The VM monitor provides advanced virtual memory statistics for Linux and Solaris systems, and has specific interfaces per operating system.

span.title:
Memory Allocation Statistics
• Analyse Memory allocation by main categories: FSCache, Process, System, Free
• Global Memory rate utilization

Real and Virtual Memory Statistics
• Memory Usage in Data Volume (MB) or Percentage
• Specific System Stats (for Linux: Buffers / Cached / Active / Inactive...)

a.span: ALL OS: Real and Virtual Memory Statistics

p.b: The MEM monitor provides various essential memory utilization statistics and has specific interfaces per operating system.

span.title:
Various Memory Statistics
• Cache Hit Ratio, System Buffer Accesses...

p.b: The MEMUSE monitor is dedicated to AIX and Solaris systems only, and it has specific interfaces per operating system.

span.title:
Memory Utilization statistics in Percentage (%) for Projects, Zones, Tasks or Users
• Same as 'prstat -J.MEMORY' (or -Z or -T or -a)
• WLMPROJECTMEM, project name • WLMZONEMEM, zone name • WLMTASKMEM, task id • WLMUSERMEM, username

a.span: Solaris: Memory load for Projects, Tasks, Zones, Users

span.title:
Transfer Statistics per Disk
• Average data size per block device transfer per disk (KBytes per transfer)

a.span: ALL OS: Average Data Transfer Size

span.title:
Percentage of Time Busy Disk
• Analyse the Percentage of Time a disk was busy

a.span: ALL OS: The Percentage of time a disk was Busy

span.title:
Disks Read and Write Data rate
• Analyse Disk Read and Write operation Data rate in Kbytes/sec

a.span: ALL OS: Disk Read/Write Data Rate

span.title:
Disks I/O per second
• Numbers of Input / Output operations per second (formerly IOPS) by disk

a.span: ALL OS: Disk I/O Operations per second (IOPS)

span.title:
Disks Read and Write I/O per second
• Read or Write Numbers of Input / Output operations per second (formerly IOPS) by disk

a.span: ALL OS: Disk Read/Write I/O per second (IOPS)

span.title:
(ms) Average service time by disk
• Same as 'sar -d.avserv'
• Same as 'iostat -xn.asvc_t'. For iostat, a disk is referred as a device'

(ms) Average wait time by disk
• Same as 'sar -d.avwait'
• Same as 'iostat -xn.wsvc_t'. For iostat, a disk is referred as a device'

File Systems Percentage Usage
• Percentage usage of different file systems available

a.span: ALL OS: File systems Percentage Usage

span.title:
File Systems Inode Percentage Usage
• Percentage Inode usage of different file systems available

a.span: AIX: File systems Inode Percentage Usage

span.title:
Network Traffic per interface
• Analyse Traffic Data per interface in Kbps / Mbps / Gbps and per host

a.span: ALL OS: Traffic Data Rate per Interface

span.title:
Network Packets per interface
• Analyse the Number of Read and Write Network packets per interface and per host

a.span: ALL OS: Read/Write packets per Interface

span.title:
Network Packets in Error per interface
• Analyse the Number of Network packets that in error per interface and per host

a.span: AIX, SOLARIS: Error packets per Interface

span.title:
Network File System (NFS) Server and Client Statistics
• Analyse various NFS Client and Server Statistics, eligible for NFS version 2/3/4

Ethernet (Shared and Physical) Adapters Traffic Analysis
• Analyse Traffic Data for Shared and Physical Ethernet Adapters in Kbps / Mbps / Gbps and per host

Ethernet Shared Adapters Read/Write Packets Analysis
• Analyse Number of Read/Write packets for Shared Ethernet Adapters and per host

Nmon Baseline Analysis
• With the baseline Nmon KV Store, use this interface to analyse historical data and detect key system metrics derivations
• Key system metrics (CPU usage, Real and Virtual Memory, IOPS disk statistics) charted over the baseline
• Optionally chart current statistics over the future baseline and get realtime situation of system resources utilization

CPU Predictive Analysis Interface
• Using the predict Splunk command, this interface will help trying to estimate future CPU load of your systems
• Choose between available algorithms: Local Level (LL), Seasonal Local Level (LLP) and Local Level Trend (LLT)
• Interact with the Prediction adding your own input knowledge to take in consideration futures projects and so on

Nmon Comparison Interface
• Compare System Resources usage between 2 periods, a reference Period and arrival Period
• Choose between Main Monitors: CPU usage (CPU_ALL / LPAR), Memory, I/O, Network
• Evaluate the trend with Evolution Rate and graphical decorations to help instantly discover the comparison result

BubbleChart: TOP hosts CPU Usage
• Evaluate the TOP 100 hosts CPU load represented in Bubble Charts to instantly discover hosts responsible of the global load average
• Evaluate the TOP 20 hosts CPU load represented in d3chart bar chart
• Evaluate the full Statistics table of hosts CPU load with main hosts information

p.b: The TOP bubble chart dashboard provides a graphical view of TOP hosts using CPU, and has specific versions and/or options per operating system.

span.title:
PieChart: TOP Hosts CPU and Memory Usage
• Evaluate the TOP 30 CPU Usage hosts in d3chart Donut chart / CPU Usage hosts in Statistics table
• Evaluate the TOP 30 Real Memory Usage hosts in d3chart Donut chart / Real Memory Usage hosts in Statistics table
• Evaluate the TOP 30 Virtual Memory Usage hosts in d3chart Donut chart / Virtual Memory Usage hosts in Statistics table

p.b: The TOP d3js dashboard provides a graphical view of TOP hosts using CPU / Memory in donut charts, and has specific versions and/or options per operating system.

span.title:
D3chart: Processes CPU and Memory Usage
• Evaluate Processes CPU and Memory usage in d3chart BubbleChart to instantly represent major Command invocations
• Represent this CPU / Memory usage in a d3chart chart over time

a.span: D3chart: Processes CPU and Memory Usage

p.b: The TOP processes dashboard provides a graphical view of TOP hosts / processes using CPU / Memory, and has specific versions and/or options per operating system.

span.title:
D3chart: Solaris Projects / Zones / Tasks / Users CPU and Memory statistics
• Evaluate Major CPU and MEM usage items, choose between available monitors
• Represent this CPU / Memory usage in a d3chart bubblechart and statistic tables

a.span: D3chart: Solaris WLM CPU and Memory Statistics

span.title:
Hosts Configuration Show Interface
• Explore the raw configuration of hosts
• The full raw host configuration is part of AAA and BBB sections of raw Nmon files

Nmon Configuration Inventory
• Explore the Nmon inventory of known hosts from your system to get valuable information
• Main configuration Items depends on Operating System: type of OS, OS version, CPU / Mem configuration and more

Data Processing Activity: Calendar
Analyse in Heatmap Calendars the Nmon Processing Activity:
• Volume of Raw Data Proceeded (in MB)
• Errors in Data Processing (Count of)
• Time Spent in Data Processing (in Seconds, conversion of NMON files)

Data Performance Activity: Calendar
Analyse in Heatmap Calendars type of Performance Data available for hosts

Application Internal Statistics
• Analyse detailed Nmon Processing Statistics: Conversion of raw Nmon data files
• Get indexes and sourcetypes Statistics
• Get Applications Statistics: Volume of Data indexes, Number of Hits per page

Data Dictionary
• Discover and Explore available data within the Nmon Splunk Application
• Filter relevant Data for AIX, Linux and Solaris systems
• Access to full metric definition: brieve and full description, relevant unity, formula...
